SEARCH
Package entities

Class Player

java.lang.Object
entities.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ComputerPlayer
public class Player extends Object implements Serializable
Represents each player in the game. The Player class keeps track of their hand (cards they're holding), the cards they’ve collected, their score, and handles stuff for online games like input/output streams.
See Also:

      Returns:
      Formatted hand string

    • getOutputSteam

      public ObjectOutputStream getOutputSteam()
      Returns the ObjectOutputStream associated with the player. This stream is used to send serialised objects (eg. game state updates)
      Returns:
      an ObjectOutputStream used for sending objects

    • getInputSteam

      public ObjectInputStream getInputSteam()
      Returns the ObjectOutputStream associated with the player. This stream is used to receive serialised objects (eg. the player's moves)
      Returns:
      an ObjectInputStream used for receiving objects

    • checkColours

      public boolean checkColours()
      Checks if the player has collected at least one card from *each* of the six colours. Used for ending the game.
      Returns:
      True if the player has all 6 colours, false otherwise

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Gives a String representation in the format {name} | Hand: {hand} + | Collected: {collected}
